data.text: I don't know what you mean to say, what are you asking?.... Oh, you're trying to explain "planning".... The major Part of my excitement for adventure is discovery, the greatest disappointments arrive primarily by expectations unfulfilled.....I ride for enjoyment and adventure and discovery...... Looking too far forward or planning or expecting something is the way to find disappointment and spoil the discovery and limit my enjoyment of the adventure. I do a little research to make sure that I haven't stumbled on a common route for cyclists then I talk to locals and learn what's interesting.... And, because there's not a million cyclists passing by each year, I'm a novelty and people are kind and curious and helpful. I've ridden the PCH, it was ok, Oregon it's nice, the Olympic peninsula.... But, nothing like Nemiah Valley and the Chilcotin...... Find an ACA nap for that adventure.... Try to find a market on the way. ;-). That's interesting....I can ride in traffic any day.

data.text: Everybody has their own reason for riding, I ride to experience a life I'm denied in society, a life according to natural cycles of day and night, of energy and repose, of sights and sounds and experience and contemplation. Society tells me how I behave and when, I have to invent a mask...a persona.... To participate in society.....I ride to discover who I am in reality, who I am outside of society..... And, I like that person so much better, and, I have so little interest in the other or society. Don't ride a bike, you'll risk becoming a misenthrope like me. ;-)
